recipe.title: How to Make Edamame
recipe.intro: Edamame is boiled young soybeans. It is a simple and healthy Japanese snack.
steps: **Put** salt on the edamame and rub them with your hands.
**Boil** a big pot of water with some salt.
**Add** the edamame to the boiling water.
**Cook** for 4 minutes, then take them out.
**Put** a little more salt on top and eat them from the shell. **Enjoy!**

review.content: I visited Ocean Breeze Cafe last week. It was near the river in West End. There was a lovely ocean-blue wall inside. I sat on a soft sofa by the window. The breeze from outside was nice and cool. I ordered edamame and a cold drink. The edamame had just the right amount of salt. It was so good with my drink. There were jasmine flowers in a small vase on the table. The cafe was very relaxing. I stayed for two hours and read my book.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Let's get some snacks. What do you want?

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: How about edamame? Do they have it here?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Yes, look! It is on the menu. Good idea!

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Great. I love edamame with a cold drink.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Me too! Excuse me, can we get one edamame, please?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Do you eat edamame a lot in Japan?

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Yes, we eat it in summer. It is a popular snack.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: How do you eat it? I am new to this.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: You push the beans out of the shell with your fingers.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Like this? Oh, it is easy and fun!

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Yes! And do not eat the shell. Only the beans inside.
